com.ibm.team.build.ant.task
Class AbstractTeamBuildTask

java.lang.Object
  Task
      com.ibm.team.build.ant.task.AbstractTeamBuildTask
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractPublisherTask, AbstractRetrieverTask, GenerateChangeLogTask, GetNextBuildRequestTask, RequestBuildTask, StartBuildTask, TeamAcceptTask, TeamFetchTask, TeamLastModifiedTask, WaitForTeamBuildTask
public abstract class AbstractTeamBuildTask
extends Task

Base ant task for the Team Build System. Ant tasks that need to interact with the build data model in the team repository should subclass this class.

Required attributes:

  • repositoryAddress - The address of the team repository to connect to.
  • One of the following:
    1. -userId - login to the repository as this user AND
      -pass or -passwordFile
    2. -certificateFile - the file containing the user's login certificate AND
      -pass or -passwordFile
    3. -smartCard - use the connected smart card for authentication AND
      -userId (alias name)
    4. -repositoriesFile - the repositories registry file (containing a listing of repositories and their login credentials)

Optional attributes:

  • verbose - If true, more output will be printed. Defaults to false.
  • failOnError - Defaults to true. If false , some errors will be ignored.

Additional attributes:

  • createPasswordFile - Creates a password file.

Since:
0.5

collectAntAttributes

protected abstract void collectAntAttributes(java.util.List antAttributes)
Abstract method that collects the attributes associated with the Ant task. All attributes are collected into the same list. Derived classes should override and add their ant attributes to the list. The list should contain attributes of type AntAttribute.

doExecute

protected abstract void doExecute()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Abstract method that is invoked to do the actual work that needs to occur during the execution of the Ant task.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If derived client needs to abort processing of the ant task.

execute

public final void execute()
                   throws BuildException
Entry point for execution of all team build ant tasks. It helps ensure a common validation and execution strategy for all tasks.

Throws:
BuildException
See Also:
org.apache.tools.ant.Task#execute()

logException

protected final void logException(java.lang.Exception exception,
                                  int messagePriorty)
Creates the call stack for the exception and logs it using the specified message priority. See org.apache.tools.ant.Project for valid message priority values.

Parameters:
exception - The exception to create a call stack for and log.
messagePriorty - The message priority to use when logging the message.

configureTaskAttributes

protected void configureTaskAttributes()
Provides an opportunity to configure the task attributes prior for validation. For example, perhaps its acceptable to use a project property in place of a task attribute if the task did not supply that attribute but it is defined in the Ant project.

getAntAttributes

protected final AbstractTeamBuildTask.AntAttribute[] getAntAttributes()
Retrieves a list of all AntAttribute instances that make up the attributes for the task.

Returns:
a list of all AntAttribute instances that make up the attributes for the task.

validateAttribute

protected void validateAttribute(AbstractTeamBuildTask.AntAttribute theAttribute)
                          throws AbstractTeamBuildTask.IllegalAntAttributeException
Validates the specified attribute. This method can be overridden if the derived client needs more or less stringent validity checking for a particular attribute.

Parameters:
theAttribute - the attribute to verify the validity of.
Throws:
AbstractTeamBuildTask.IllegalAntAttributeException - thrown if a required attribute is null or if the attribute is empty when trimmed of all whitespace, or if the attribute is illegally used (e.g. in combination with another attribute which is not allowed).

                                    java.lang.String attributeName)
Helper method to determine if an AntAttribute is a particular attribute.

Parameters:
theAttribute - the attribute to inspect
attributeName - the name of the desired attribute
Returns:
true if an AntAttribute represents a particular attribute.
